Detailed Description

template<class T>
class Array2D< T >

A class for handling the special case of 2-dimensional arrays. The class uses a pointer matrix to increase the efficiency.

Besides the normal internal structure of arrays as given in the template class Array, a pointer matrix for direct access of each array element is administrated. Especially when accessing single array rows, this additional structure speeds up operations.

Author:
M. Kreutz
Date:
2001-04-24
Changes:
none
Status:
stable

Member Function Documentation

template<class T>
void Array2D< T >::allocPtrArr (  )  [inline, protected]

Creates a new pointer matrix and allocates memory for it.

Based on the structure of the current template Array object, memory for the pointer matrix is allocated.
If there is only an empty array, then also no memory for the pointer matrix is allocated.
If there is a non-empty array, then the corresponding memory for the pointer matrix is allocated and the single pointers are set to the elements in the array element vector Array::e.
Be cautious! It is not checked whether the array is really 2-dimensional.

Returns:
none
Author:
M. Kreutz
Date:
2001-04-24
Changes
none
Status
stable

template<class T>
const const_iterator Array2D< T >::begin (  )  const [inline]

Returns a constant iterator to the first array element.

A constant pointer to the first element of the element vector Array::e of the current array is returned as iterator.
This method is used for compatibility with the other stdlib structures.

template<class T>
void Array2D< T >::resize_i ( unsigned *  dimA,
unsigned  ndimA,
bool  copyA 
) [inline, protected, virtual]

Handles memory allocation for the other resize methods, including allocation of the pointer matrix.

This function handles memory allocation of the respective template type and the pointer matrix in case of resizing and is only for internal use.

Parameters:
dimA one-dimensional vector of array-dimensions
ndimA number of array-dimensions, must be zero or 2
copyA flag which indicates whether existing elements of an array should be copied in case of resizing (as long as possible)
Returns:
none
Exceptions:
check_exception the type of the exception will be "size mismatch" and indicates that ndimA is not 2-dimensional and not non-dimensional or that the current array is a static array reference and the sizes given by dimA and ndimA are not the same than the current array has
Author:
M. Kreutz
Date:
2001-04-24
Changes
none
Status
stable

Array::resize_i(unsigned*, unsigned, bool)

Member Data Documentation

template<class T>
T** Array2D< T >::ptrArrM [protected]

Additional pointer matrix to the single elements of the current 2-dimensional array.


This pointer matrix is used for more efficiency, because you can use it to directly access e.g. single rows of the array.
